I was in Qatar when this happened. I think a good video would be studying the physics of rifle ballistics, specifically hand loading of the rifle ammo.  Look up "barrel harmonics" as it relates to seating depth of the bullet and "ladder tests" of people trying different powders with different burn rates and seating depths.  There is a lot going on and could be some high speed camera fun.  You will probably never see this but worth a shot! Hmmm... the guy who said you can't just use multiple pairs of sunglasses?  I'd like confirmation of the following from a competent 'scientist'.  If you use two pairs of polarized sunglasses, with lenses placed at 90 degrees to one another, you can view it perfectly without squinting or injury.  I've been doing this for such solar events for 30 years now, and still have 20:20 vision and never any pain/issues/etc.  So... was my dad's generation wrong, because he taught this to me when I was 5. :D
I used a pair of binoculars and a piece of white paper. Really simple. Really effective. It was awesome. Me and some friends had a little party for it.
